result.execSummary:
The defendant Laila O Al Khateb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Domestic Violence Counseling or Anger Management and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.  Parenting class if Agent deems appropriate.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victims K.A., J.M. or B.M. listed in case 14CM2253 which is dismissed and read in.    No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores).  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling, recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  Surcharge is imposed.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laila O Al Khateb

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Failure to Meet Conditions for Expungement filed by Department of Corrections.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Treatment Letter, received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Laila O Al Khateb in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  

Defendant enters a plea of Alford No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.




Court orders the following:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.


Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Domestic Violence or Anger Managment Counseling and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
Parenting Class if agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  Victims (K.A., J.M. or B.M.) list in case 14CM2253.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Laila O Al Khateb in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.

Atty. Martinez presented statements to the court.
Defendant currently inpatient at the Dewey Center.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   
Defendant Laila O Al Khateb did not appear.   
Case scheduled for 10:30 am. and Matter called @ 10:49 am.

Court orders a stayed warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED OR A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to Appear, received and filed in court.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   
Defendant Laila O Al Khateb did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by Authorization.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Laila O Al Khateb in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  

Defense waiting on Discovery and a PreTrial Offer.
  Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Laila O Al Khateb in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
